i will never come to your place again.   and i will be the voice of consumers who are sick of getting ripped off by people or group like you.!!

People...  PLEASE stop patronizing places like this!!

Do not take your Birkenstock sandals for repairs to this place! First of all, they led  me to believe that they are replacing everything but the straps. When I came in to pick them up I noticed that the footbed was not replaced and I asked the person who brought my sandals about it to which he said it would have been extra 30$ and walked away. I was so disappointed that I didn't want to inspect the sandals any further and left the store. At home I started looking at them and  got even more frustrated because they did a terrible job. I payed 70$ for my sandals to look worse than before repair! I would have gotten a better repair in a third world country! And considering the previous reviewer's experience with them, it is pointless taking them back and trying to talk with the people working there. 
And this place has been doing Birkenstock repairs for 40 years?!?!? That was the only reason I agreed thinking that they know what they're doing.

Update: Is this a "quality repair" that falls apart one month later?

I first went to Carolinas Natural Health Center to take part in their Ultra Lite Weight Loss program. I connected with the entire staff from day one. Ultra Lite not only helped me reach my goal weight, but taught me how to keep it off. I was also impressed with their menu of  services including facials with Eminence products, Thai foot massages, pregnancy massages just to name a few. Most importantly, as a Naturopathic physician, Dr. Smith takes a natural approach to healing the body from within and treating the person, not just the symptom or disease. I am thoroughly impressed each and every time I visit Carolinas Natural Health Center.
Great full body workout combining weights, pilates and ballet with small isolated movements with upbeat music.  Results evident after 10 classes. Well worth the monthly dues.

Located in the basement of Organic Marketplace on New Hope Road, the staff makes fresh soups and hummus daily. Also homemade salad dressings on thier raw food and salad bar. They make healthy wraps and pizzas and have a great selection of smoothies.

Amazing sushi, I love going here because it's decent price for good sushi. 

What I don't like is the servers, they never smile, can't seem to figure out how to take care of there tables. I am a regular here, I go about once a weekend and the servers are still rude. Never expect a drink refill or for them to talk to you after you get your food.

Paying to much money for a gym that's always packed. Tried bringing my daughter and they stated she needed an ID who brings their ID to the gym? I'm paying you money to be here and to be able to bring a guest. Find a better gym that's nots packed all day long. Equipment is never open, leaving this gym and going somewhere else that's cheaper and less packed. Look other places before coming here.
THE DRYEST BURGER IVE EVER EATEN.... $40 for 2 burgers and fries and I would rather eat a McDonald's double cheeseburger.

Had duck fried rice which was full of small crunchy bones. The cashew chicken had a funky odor and the pad thai was horrible. Not to mention the restaurant is dirty and condiment bottles are crusty. This place is overpriced for poor quality food. We will not be going back!
Excellent food and wonderful service! The best Reuben sandwich I have ever eaten. And the iced tea is very good and the prices are hard to beat. We will be back :)

I love this place... been getting massages there for years and have never been disappointed. Become a member for the best price as the ala cart prices are a bit high. Gorgeous relaxation room. Wish I could recreate that room in my house! And their music is very relaxing. Sauna is perfect to ward off Cleveland's winter cold. Love the staff. They couldn't be nicer.

I figured the wait on a Sunday would be long and it was. 25-30 minutes turned into an hour for a table in the restaurant not a high top at the bar. Server was just ok. Never checked on us once to refill drinks until we were ready to leave. Probably because we didn't order beer. Wings were excellent. We ordered dry rub with 2 sides of sauce. Hubby's burger (Thick Rick) and fries were delicious - enough for 3 people! STAY AWAY from the Bay of Pigs Cuban pork sandwich. It was nothing like the sandwich described by the PD food editor. Unless you like 80% fat and gristle. It was gross... I'd definitely come back but stick with a burger or chicken sandwich.

Bellagio is disgusting. They have decided to cater to ghetto people and the homeless. I was told I had $300. In resort fees and parking fees in addition to the price of the room. I felt sucker punched. Asked why, she said all resorts are charging and bellagio isn't as much as other resorts. What? Why not just include it into the price of the room? I had planned on tossing around thousands of dollars on gambling, dining, entertainment and shopping. But since bellagio insists on catering to ghetto people who only have a couple hundred dollars to spend have damaged thousands of dollars in resort property. I refused to spend another dime here. The room overlooked the fountains but was small and beat up, obviously by the ghetto people bellagio caters to nowadays. Homeless are lounging around the hallways and the lobby, kind of smells bad.
Update: now bellagio wants to bill me for more hidden charges. Check it out, these new charges are from July 13th, we left on the 2nd, watch out for this place, they are dishonest. Total disaster!!!!

Service here SUCKS. I came here for breakfast on a Saturday morning. Food came out ok, when the check came out, I advised my waiter my host at Venetian will take care of the bill and they had forwarded the comp to Casanova's computer. My waiter walked to the back, talked to someone and came out telling me that comps only work for lunch and dinner, not breakfast. Uhhhhh......wth? Since when were comps allowed only for certain times. I called my host, my host told me that its weird, it's supposed to work anytime. I told him i wanna speak to the manager, and he showed me to someone named Maria, i told her the situation and she said they never got the comp from my host, and even if they did, it only works for lunch and dinner. I called my host again, and told my host to speak with Maria, Maria told my host they never received the voucher, guess what happens....... she then said their system is down so they never got it. So i told them you know what, forget it, i'll pay for it. So i paid.

I was waiting around 30 minutes for them, then she tells me their damn system was down? Really? It took that long? Such pathetic service, my host had to tell guest services to walk the voucher up to them.

NEVER COMING BACK AGAIN

I have been looking for a used 750. I have searched and searched. My name must be at every dealer in Vegas. A few of them have reached out to be with a car they found but It had so many miles. I am searching but im not desperate, I still want and good running car, in good condition. One of the last dealers I stoped by was Desert BMW. Within one week Desert had reached back out to me and had a car on their lot. I went down the same day and they pulled off what looked like the impossible. Good job guys and keep up the great work.
going to a BBQ?? this is the places to pick up your stuff..
i have been here a few times. very time you are here you feel like there is a really big part of Nevada's history is here.

So disappointed.  There were five hostesses standing around as we showed up ten minutes early for our lunch reservation,. We were seated about 12 minutes after our requested time.  Once seated we waited forever for a server.  The entire experience was just SLOW.  My meal was just average, the salad was overdressed and we had to ask for water and more drinks.

I was glad I did not suggest this restaurant since everyone in our group was let down
the most accomodating gluten free menu on the planet.
There is reason this is the most popular Sunday brunch in Vegas,   Do not let the long line intimidate you, it moves fast.

If the show extreme makeover hotel edition is looking for a project, the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas should be the pilot episode.  We stayed only one night last week because it was beyond gross.  Here is a short list of the problems that must be addressed:

Huge stain in carpet near our bed
Molded grout in the bathroom
Faint lipstick stain on drinking glasses in the bathroom
Cigarette burn in the sheets 

If our client had not paid for our room in advance, we would have checked out and stayed somewhere else for the single night.  

Do.  Not.  Expect.  To. Be. Impressed.

I'm always looking for a high quality, value minded happy hour for an early dinner of appetizers.  If you're in Las Vegas for a show, or arrive from the east coast and are ready for dinner at 6:00 (it was 9:00 in NY and we had flown all day). this is a winner. 

The bar area is table service with a dozen different choices for snacks that add up to a meal.  Sushi, and cocktails at a bargain price.   The pineapple martini is a hefty pour with flavor.  

We (3 of us) ate and drank for an hour and a half in the bar during the aloha hour time period 5:00-6:30 pm.  We each had 2 cocktail drinks and more food than we should have,  we essentially had a full dinner from the aloha menu, with taxes and a 20% tip for superior service our bill was $78.

Excellent!

-Free Guacamole during happy hour!
-HUGE menu
-Ordered a salad, gazpacho, grilled octopus, and artichoke appetizer.  All were DELICIOUS!
-Friendly and attentive waitstaff.

Only negative--Sangria was just OK.  

Will definitely return! Great place!!
Excellent Thai food. We go here at least once a month. The staff is courteous and the food tasty. Service is fast. This is great value for money and kid friendly as well. Try it!
